intro: Filago hispanica, commonly known as Spanish sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are linear and fleshy, adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils. Filago hispanica is often found in coastal areas and is sometimes considered an indicator species for disturbed or saline environments.
